item.title: India’s mutual fund investors have got their 1st taste of a big market shake-up. It’s made them cautious - ThePrint
item.description:
India’s mutual fund investors have got their 1st taste of a big market shake-up. It’s made them cautious.

Publication Date: December 12, 2024 Source: ThePrint

India's mutual fund investors are becoming increasingly cautious in response to recent stock market volatility, with the market experiencing a notable correction over the past months that has affected their systematic investment plans (SIPs).

  • New investors are feeling the impact of a 10% market drop within two months.
  • Net SIP account additions have declined for four consecutive months, marking a significant trend.
  • The stoppage ratio of SIP accounts, or closures versus openings, has surged to 79.1%—the highest since April 2022.
  • Foreign institutional investors have withdrawn Rs 1.6 lakh crore from Indian markets over October and November.
  • Demat accounts surged from 4.09 crore in April 2020 to 17.9 crore in October 2024, indicating a rise in new investors.
“The 10 percent correction from the September peak—the first 10 percent correction for most newbies—has unnerved many.” - V.K. Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services.

The cautious approach among SIP investors is seen as a knee-jerk reaction to recent market conditions, but analysts believe that as the market stabilizes, these investors will likely return to their investment plans.

item.title: Stock Market Weekly Recap: SENSEX, NIFTY rebound to extend gains for 4th week; NIFTY IT hits lifetime high - Upstox
item.description:
Stock Market Weekly Recap: SENSEX, NIFTY rebound to extend gains for 4th week; NIFTY IT hits lifetime high

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: [Insert Source Here]

It was a roller coaster ride for Indian stock markets this week, but benchmark indices closed higher, extending gains for the fourth consecutive week, driven by strong performances from key sectors.

  • Bharti Airtel, Bajaj Finance, Infosys, and Wipro were major gainers, while Tata Consumer Products, HUL, NTPC, and Reliance Industries saw losses.
  • The NIFTY IT index reached a lifetime high of 46,088.90, increasing over 2.5% for the week.
  • Religare Enterprises shares rose by 10% following RBI approval for the Burman family to acquire an additional stake.
“SENSEX advanced 623.07 points, or 0.76%, while NIFTY gained 90.5 points, or 0.36%, on a weekly basis.”

Despite volatility and cautious investor sentiment linked to global political instability and upcoming US Federal Reserve decisions, the markets showed resilience, with domestic investors buying on dips. This week witnessed significant fluctuations in trading, ending on a positive note with a surge in buying activity.

item.title: 10:1 Stock Split: 1st-ever sub-division by this multibagger stock; shares rally 8500% in 3 years - ET Now
item.description:
10:1 Stock Split: 1st-ever sub-division by this multibagger stock; shares rally 8500% in 3 years

Publication Date: Updated Dec 14, 2024 10:17 IST

Source: ET NOW News

Arunjyoti Bio Ventures Ltd. has announced a 10:1 stock split, marking its first-ever subdivision of shares. This action aims to enhance share affordability and market liquidity as the company continues its robust growth.

  • Arunjyoti Bio Ventures will split each equity share from Rs 10 into ten shares of Re 1 each.
  • This stock split is intended to make shares more accessible for small investors.
  • The company has recorded a remarkable 8500% increase in share price over the past three years.
  • Shares closed at Rs 159, down 3.55% from the previous day.
  • Market capitalization stands at Rs 296.35 crore.
  • The record date for the stock split will be announced after shareholder approval.
“The record date is the cutoff set by a company to decide which shareholders are eligible for corporate actions like dividends, stock splits or bonus shares.”

In conclusion, Arunjyoti Bio Ventures' announcement of a stock split is a strategic move to enhance liquidity and accessibility for investors, reflecting the company's impressive growth trajectory in recent years.

item.title: Bonus Share: BUY 1 get 9 FREE; record date next week - ET Now
item.description:
Bonus Share: BUY 1 get 9 FREE; record date next week

Publication Date: December 14, 2024

Source: ET NOW News

A smallcap company, Sky Gold, has announced a bonus issue of shares at a 9:1 ratio. Shareholders are set to receive nine free shares for every one share held, with the record date being fixed for next week.

  • A smallcap company has announced a bonus issue of shares in the ratio 9:1.
  • The stock has delivered a remarkable 4,828% return over the past three years.
  • The company's board has set the record date for December 16, 2024.
“This stock has been a true multibagger, delivering a jaw-dropping 4,828% return over the past three years.”

The Sky Gold shares closed at Rs 4,435.30 per share, with a 52-week range from Rs 902.1 to Rs 4,680. This announcement is seen as a way to reward shareholders and enhance liquidity.

item.title: Tata Motors Split, Share Price: Can Tata stock bounce back to Rs 1000 again? Check target and demerger ratio - ET Now
item.description:
```html

Tata Motors Split, Share Price: Can Tata stock bounce back to Rs 1000 again? Check target and demerger ratio

Publication Date: Dec 14, 2024

Source: ET NOW

Tata Motors, a favorite among retail investors, has disappointed in 2024 with a steep correction. Investors are curious about the future of Tata Motors shares and if they can bounce back to Rs 1000 in 2025.

  • Tata Motors shares have remained flat on a YTD basis and delivered a 9% return in the last year.
  • Current market price is Rs 790.60, a 33% discount from the 52-week high of Rs 1,179.05.
  • Analysts suggest a cautious approach with an RSI of 51 on the monthly, 35 on the weekly, and 40 on the daily time frame.
  • Recommended buying range is between Rs 680 and Rs 740 for a target price between Rs 800 and Rs 1170.
  • Tata Motors plans to demerge into two companies: commercial vehicles and passenger vehicles, with a 1:1 demerger ratio.
"Judging the price momentum, I recommend market participants avoid aggressive buying at this level. Those interested may consider the buying range between Rs 680 and Rs 740 for a target price between Rs 800 and Rs 1170," the analyst said.

Tata Motors is expected to complete the demerger in the first quarter of the next financial year. Investors should consult their financial advisors before making any investment decisions.

```

item.title: Gold dips amid rising US yields ahead of next week’s FOMC meeting - FXStreet
item.description:
Gold edges lower on rising US yields, still eyes weekly gains

Publication Date: October 27, 2023 | Source: FXStreet

Gold prices have declined for two consecutive days due to rising US Treasury bond yields, but still maintain weekly gains as traders await the Federal Reserve's forthcoming decisions on interest rates.

  • Gold holds on to weekly gains despite recent price drops.
  • A 93% likelihood of a 25 basis points rate cut by the Federal Reserve is anticipated.
  • Economic data releases will be crucial for market direction in the upcoming weeks.
  • Gold prices fell 0.80%, with XAU/USD trading at $2,657.
  • Traders are keenly focused on Fed Chair Powell's press conference post-rate decision.
"We have reached the time of year when convictions are low, and positions are being held on a short leash, meaning any price reversal - in both directions - will quickly be met with position-squaring."

In conclusion, while gold experiences short-term pressure from increased yields, it seems poised for potential gains as traders remain optimistic about future Federal Reserve actions.

item.title: Zepto spent Rs 5,747 Cr to earn Rs 4,454 Cr in FY24 - Entrackr
item.description:
Zepto spent Rs 5,747 Cr to earn Rs 4,454 Cr in FY24

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Entrackr

Quick commerce startup Zepto reported a substantial increase in revenue during FY24, while marginally reducing its losses compared to the previous fiscal year.

  • Revenue from operations increased 2.2X to Rs 4,454 crore in FY24, up from Rs 2,026 crore in FY23.
  • Overall expenditure rose to Rs 5,747 crore, marking a 71.6% increase from the previous year.
  • The company managed to cut losses by 2%, now at Rs 1,248.6 crore in FY24.
  • Zepto's market share in the quick commerce sector is 29%, making it the second-largest player.
  • Plans to launch a standalone app for its 10-minute food delivery service, Zepto Cafe.
  • The company aims to become profitable by FY26 and is considering an IPO in the second half of the next year.
"Zepto is the second-largest player in the quick commerce sector, following Blinkit, which holds a 46% share." - Motilal Oswal report

Despite the high expenditures, Zepto's revenue growth indicates a positive trajectory as it navigates the competitive quick commerce landscape and invests in future growth initiatives.

item.title: Jeff Bezos, Lauren Sanchez savour Indian flavours at chef Vikas Khanna’s Bungalow: 'Like a pilgrimage' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Jeff Bezos, Lauren Sanchez savour Indian flavours at chef Vikas Khanna’s Bungalow: 'Like a pilgrimage'

Publication Date: Dec 13, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Amazon founder Jeff Bezos and his partner Lauren Sanchez recently enjoyed a culinary experience at chef Vikas Khanna's New York restaurant, Bungalow, sharing their excitement on social media.

  • Bezos described his visit to Bungalow as "like a pilgrimage," expressing his admiration for Indian cuisine.
  • The menu featured a variety of Indian dishes, including Bengali Kasundi Tandoori Avocado, Bihari Sattu Roti, and Gulab Jamun Ice-Cream with Millet-Chocolate Cake.
  • Bungalow, which opened in March 2024, received the Michelin 2024 Bib Gourmand Award shortly after its launch.
  • Bezos and Sanchez are preparing for a winter wedding in Aspen this Christmas with an anticipated star-studded guest list.
“When @JeffBezos said the visit to Bungalow was like a pilgrimage. It filled my heart with pure joy & pride.” - Vikas Khanna

The visit highlights the growing appreciation for Indian cuisine in the culinary landscape of New York, alongside the personal milestone of Bezos and Sanchez’s upcoming wedding festivities.

item.title: Lupin acquires 3 anti-diabetes trademarks from Boehringer Ingelheim International - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Lupin acquires 3 anti-diabetes trademarks from Boehringer Ingelheim International

Publication Date: December 13, 2024

Source: CNBC TV18

Drug firm Lupin Ltd has announced the acquisition of trademarks for three anti-diabetes brands from Boehringer Ingelheim International GmbH, aiming to strengthen its diabetes portfolio in India.

  • The acquired trademarks are for the brands Gibtulio, Gibtulio Met, and Ajaduo.
  • The transfer of trademark rights is expected to be completed by March 2025.
  • Lupin has been co-marketing the brands since 2016 and 2018 under a partnership with Boehringer Ingelheim India.
  • These medications belong to the SGLT-2 inhibitor class and improve glycemic control in adults with type 2 diabetes.
  • Empagliflozin is noted for reducing the risk of cardiovascular death in diabetic adults.
“This acquisition is a key step in strengthening our diabetes portfolio and reaffirms our commitment to delivering innovative and cost-effective medications for patients across India.” - Nilesh Gupta, Managing Director, Lupin
“The increasing prevalence of diabetes calls for greater thrust on treatment and management.” - Rajeev Sibal, President of India Region Formulations, Lupin

The acquisition of these trademarks is a strategic move to address the rising diabetes challenges in India and provide accessible treatment options to millions of patients across the country.

item.title: Max Life Insurance Company rebrands as Axis Max Life Insurance - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Max Life Insurance Company rebrands as Axis Max Life Insurance

Publication Date: December 13, 2024

Source: CNBC TV18

Max Life Insurance Company has rebranded as Axis Max Life Insurance Ltd, following regulatory approvals and a strategy aligning its identity with Axis Bank.

  • The rebranding aligns with a proposal announced on October 22, 2024, to incorporate 'Axis' into the company's name.
  • Max Financial Services holds 81% and Axis Bank holds 19.02% stake; Axis Bank will eventually reach a 20% stake.
  • The new logo includes Axis' iconic 'A' and burgundy shade, symbolizing modern appeal and enhanced trust.
  • The 'Double Bharosa' campaign features Indian cricket captain Rohit Sharma and his spouse, Ritika Sajdeh.
“The visual integration of Axis and Max conveys enhanced trust in the brand, encapsulating the spirit of ‘Double Bharosa’ (enhanced trust).”

This rebranding marks a significant evolution for Max Life Insurance, enhancing its partnership with Axis Bank and reflecting a commitment to growth and trust in the insurance sector.
